alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 1:38AM MST until March 23 at 7:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arizona... Verde River above Clarkdale affecting Yavapai County. For the Verde River near Clarkdale...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Verde River above Clarkdale. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, High flow could lead to bank erosion and water ponding in backwater catch basins. At 12.0 feet, Nuisance flooding of property along riverbanks. At 15.0 feet, Inundation of homes along Bates Road and Rio Verde RV park in Cottonwood begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM MST Wednesday the stage was 12.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 AM MST Wednesday was 12.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will continue to rise to around 13.5 feet early this morning, falling below flood stage this afternoon to around 10.3 feet. A second rise to around 12.8 feet is expected this evening, before falling back below flood stage by tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.0 feet on 08/01/2010. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 am MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Verde River Clarkdale 12.0 12.7 Wed 1 am MST 11.9 5.8 3.8 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz
